page.title: 17Droitwich - Changing Face
page.content: Droitwich has seen many changes in the last 70 years. Mr. W. Bispan(83) and Mr.H.J.Maycroft (69) commented on these changes. Both commented on the great growth of Droitwich and the problems that have come with it- more traffic, old shops deteriorating, lots more people coming in from outside. However, houses have changed for the better, with inside toilets and bathrooms, food and money are more plentiful than when they were young. The provision of the NHS(1948) was regarded as a great improvement. Less clothes were being worn at swimming pools, but Mr.Bispan remembers the Droitwich ladies working stripped to the waist in the local salt mines when he was young! Both remember the great celebrations on VE day and the Coronation of Queen Elizabeth 11(1953) Both like Droitwich people.
